messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: OPERATION CODE: Delta-252 DATE: 10/05/38  Last night, the art museum Lumina Gallery was the unfortunate scene of a significant heist. Thieves managed to bypass the security systems and escape with artwork worth millions. This heist bears a striking resemblance to two other robberies in neighboring cities.  LAW ENFORCEMENT ENGAGEMENT:  OPERATION LEADER: Captain A. B. Roland has been chosen to lead this multi-city investigation due to his expertise in art theft. FORENSIC TEAM: Detectives C. D. Walters and E. F. Morgan are examining the museum for fingerprints, DNA, and any other traces left behind by the perpetrators. TECH TEAM: Detectives G. H. Spencer and I. J. Adams are analyzing the electronic systems of the museum, working to reverse-engineer the method used to bypass the security. INTELLIGENCE: Lieutenant K. L. Bryant is liaising with informants in the art underworld, trying to gather leads. PATROL: Patrol Officers M. N. Clark, O. P. Smith, and Q. R. Davies have been tasked with increasing police presence in all major art institutions in the city to prevent another theft. RELATED CASES: Detective S. T. King, who previously investigated the robberies in the neighboring cities, is coordinating with Captain Roland to find any overlaps or patterns. STATEMENTS:  Art appraiser, Ms. Vera, stated: The stolen paintings are not just valuable in terms of money but also hold significant historical importance. We must recover them.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Captain A. B. Roland  
Officer Context: Captain Roland is leading the multi-city investigation into the art thefts.  
Officer Role: Captain 

Officer Name: Detective C. D. Walters  
Officer Context: Detective Walters is part of the forensics team examining the crime scene.  
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Detective E. F. Morgan  
Officer Context: Detective Morgan is also on the forensics team, working alongside Detective Walters.  
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Detective G. H. Spencer  
Officer Context: Detective Spencer is on the tech team analyzing the museum's electronic systems.  
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Detective I. J. Adams  
Officer Context: Detective Adams is assisting in understanding how the thieves bypassed security.  
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Lieutenant K. L. Bryant  
Officer Context: Lieutenant Bryant is collecting information from the art underworld.  
Officer Role: Lieutenant 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer M. N. Clark, O. P. Smith, and Q. R. Davies  
Officer Context: They are maintaining an increased police presence at art institutions.  
Officer Role: Patrol Officers 

Officer Name: Detective S. T. King  
Officer Context: Detective King is coordinating on findings from previous related cases.  
Officer Role: Detective
